subject: Science
title: Genetic Drift: Evolution by Chance
description: A quick, practical guide to Genetic Drift: Evolution by Chance.

hook.text: Not all evolution is about survival of the fittest. Some is pure luck.

buildup.text: In small populations, random events can change which traits survive.

discovery.text: If a storm kills half a small population randomly, the survivors' genes dominate â€” not because they're better.

twist.text: This 'genetic drift' is stronger in small populations. In large ones, it barely matters.

climax.text: Island species often look unusual because drift had outsized influence on their tiny populations.

punchline.text: Sometimes evolution isn't about who's best. It's about who got lucky.

quiz.question: When is genetic drift most powerful?
